name: places/ChIJV8AKIwtZwokRFHdJtVFoeQE
adrFormatAddress: 363 1st Ave., New York, NY 10010-6502, USA

originalText.text:
Cleaner than average laundromat which seems to be run by an older Chinese couple and a Hispanic lady. The couple does not speak English but the lady does, if you have any questions.

Washing machines vary between 4.75, 7.00, 9.00 and 10.50. The dryers are 5 minutes for 25 cents. There is a smaller, dirtier laundromat down 1st Ave which is cheaper for everything.

Plenty of rolling carts which appear clean and relatively new. Benches to sit on and benches to fold.

There is a cash exchange machine which works. They don't let you buy cash with a credit card or buy washes.

A few machines are out of service but most of them work. Signs all around that they don't allow sneakers in washers or dryers. Overall makes up for cleanliness what it lacks in price

originalText.text: Not sure it this is better or worse than the average laundromat, I just wish it was a bit cleaner. Most of the machines are either kinda dirty or have a funky smell to them… that probably results in your clothes being less clean than they could be (especially for the somewhat high price).

Most of the machines are either kinda dirty or have a funky smell to them… that probably results in your clothes being less clean than they could be (especially for the somewhat high price).

originalText.text:
Self service and laundry service available. Nice laundrymat with new machines that work. Coin machine to change your dollars is on site. Big washer $7.00 - $4.50 for the smaller ones. Dryers are $0.25 for 5 min.

Edit - they raised their prices for the washers - Big load $10 - Medium $7.75 - Small loads $5.25

originalText.text:
DO NOT EVER TRUST THIS DRY CLEANERS!!!

I had a $400 scarf dry cleaned in this place.

When I went to pick it up, they said they lost it. And when I asked how they lost it, they just answered me “we just lost it”…

I told them that they probably saw that it was an expensive item and they decided to steal it and they simply said ‘’yes that’s probably what happened”and just gave me a 100 dollar check for it.

Apparently, they make money by stealing your goods or items and they try to compensate by giving you a lesser value for it. It’s sad and I am posting this to protect other customers who get their laundry done at this place.

originalText.text: As others have experienced , the owners are rude especially the husband. They always seem like they are bothered if you need change. Also the washers smell like mold. You never get hot water if you choose it and I’m sure the water is recycled.  Clothes always feel dirty.
